form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Toomey (for himself and Mr. Bennet) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exemption from the tax on early distributions for certain Bureau of Prisons correctional officers who retire before age 55, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Correctional Officer Fairness Act of 2015.

section.header: Exemption from tax on early distributions

subsection.text: Subsection (t) of section 72 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Distributions to qualified Federal correctional officers from the Thrift Savings Fund

subparagraph.text: In the case of a distribution to a qualified Federal correctional officer from the Thrift Savings Fund established under section 8437 of title 5, United States Code, paragraph (2)(A)(v) of this subsection shall be applied by substituting age 50 (or, if earlier, the age at which the employee has completed 25 years of creditable service) for age 55.
For purposes of this paragraph, the term qualified Federal correctional officer means an individualâ€”

clause.text: who is employed by the Federal Bureau of Prisons as a correctional officer, and
who has completed 20 years of creditable service.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term creditable service means creditable service under section 8332 or 8411 of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to distributions made after December 31, 2015.
